oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Copy of photograph of Pvt. Williams Howard Bond, Co. I, 152nd Inf. Regt., 38th Div.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Pvt. William Howard Bond, Co. I, 152 Inf. Regt., 38th Div. was from Thompson Station, Tennessee. The 38th Division was composed of National Guard units from Indiana, Ohio, Kentucky, Delaware, Michigan, Tennessee, and West Virginia. It was known as the "Cyclone Division" after a tornado hit their encampment at Camp Shelby, Mississippi. They arrived in France in October 1918 and served as replacements for other units. Bond ended the war in the 52nd Guard Co. of the Ammunition Supply operations.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Bond, William Howard
World War, 1914-1918; World War, 1914-1918 - History
